shows.title: Arcane
shows.scoring_notes: League of Legends adaptation that transcends source. Visual style revolutionary. Powder/Jinx story is heartbreaking. S1 complete arc, S2 announced. Animation's new gold standard.

shows.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender
shows.scoring_notes: Animation masterpiece. Aang's journey is complete storytelling. S3 Zuko redemption arc is peerless. For all ages but never childish. Complete series with perfect ending.

shows.title: Scavengers Reign
shows.scoring_notes: Alien ecosystem masterpiece. Biological horror and beauty. Visual storytelling at its finest. Complete season. Cancelled but perfect as-is. Sci-fi animation essential viewing.

shows.title: Blue Eye Samurai
shows.scoring_notes: Edo-period revenge tale. Mizu's journey is brutal and beautiful. Animation stunning. Action choreography exceptional. S1 complete, S2 announced. Netflix's best animation since Arcane.

shows.title: Hannibal (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Mikkelsen's Lecter is elegance and terror. Fuller's food porn aesthetic. S2 'Mizumono' is TV's best season finale. Canceled too soon. Complete story truncated. S1-3 peak.

shows.title: Mr. Robot (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Esmail's hacker thriller. Malek's Elliot is iconic. S1 is perfect. S2-3 expand beautifully. S4 completes story. Tech accuracy unprecedented. Fight Club meets hacktivism.

shows.title: My Brilliant Friend
shows.scoring_notes: Ferrante adaptation. Naples female friendship. HBO international. Complete.

shows.title: The Expanse (S1-5)
shows.scoring_notes: Hard sci-fi masterpiece. Solar system politics. Holden crew. S1-5 peak. S6 truncated but complete. Book adaptation excellent.

shows.title: I May Destroy You
shows.scoring_notes: Coel masterpiece. Sexual consent exploration. Chewing Gum creator. BBC/HBO.

shows.title: The Haunting of Hill House
shows.scoring_notes: Flanagan's haunted house masterpiece. Crain family tragedy across timelines. 'Two Storms' is technical brilliance. Complete limited series. Emotional horror, not just scares.

shows.title: The Queens Gambit
shows.scoring_notes: Taylor-Joy mesmerizing. Chess prodigy. 60s aesthetic. Complete limited. Netflix prestige.

shows.title: Fleabag
shows.scoring_notes: Waller-Bridge masterpiece. Breaking fourth wall. S2 priest arc. Complete 2 seasons. Perfect.

shows.title: Invincible (S1)
shows.scoring_notes: Kirkman's superhero deconstruction. S1 finale is shocking. Steven Yeun and JK Simmons voice cast. S2 ongoing but S1 is complete arc. Brutal, subversive, heartfelt.

shows.title: Battlestar Galactica (2004)
shows.scoring_notes: Reimagined space opera. S1-2 are peak sci-fi TV. Political allegory, religious themes. S3-4 decline but finish strong. Olmos and McDonnell anchor. Complete series.

shows.title: The Terror (S1)
shows.scoring_notes: Arctic horror. Harris and Hinds. Franklin expedition. AMC gem.

shows.title: The Good Place
shows.scoring_notes: Afterlife ethics comedy. Schur philosophy. Bell and Danson perfect. Complete 4 seasons. Ending is perfect. Comedy with depth.

shows.title: Barry (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Hader hitman turned actor. S1-3 peak. S4 wraps. Dark comedy excellence. Berg and Hader create classic. Complete.

shows.title: Unbelievable
shows.scoring_notes: True crime. Dever and Collette. Rape case investigation. Emmy worthy. Complete.

shows.title: BoJack Horseman (S1-5)
shows.scoring_notes: Hollywoo satire meets depression portrait. 'Fish Out of Water' is perfect. S1-5 peak before decline. Animation enables surreal depth. Will Arnett's best role. Complete series.

shows.title: Narcos (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: Moura's Escobar is terrifying. S1-2 complete Escobar saga. S3 Mexico pivot weaker. True story power. Wagner Moura transformed. Complete Escobar arc.

shows.title: Peaky Blinders (S1-4)
shows.scoring_notes: Murphy's Tommy Shelby is iconic. Birmingham gangster rise. S1-4 peak. S5-6 decline. Style over substance at times. Visual flair unmatched. Complete.

shows.title: Outlander (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Time travel romance. Heughan and Balfe chemistry. S1-3 peak. Scotland, France, America. Gabaldon adaptation beautiful.

shows.title: Unorthodox
shows.scoring_notes: Hasidic escape. Yiddish series. Shira Haas incredible. Berlin self-discovery.

shows.title: The OA (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: Marling's dimension-hopping mystery. S1 finale divides. S2 expands beautifully. Cancelled on cliffhanger. What exists is remarkable. For patient, curious viewers. Unique TV.

shows.title: Altered Carbon (S1)
shows.scoring_notes: Kinnaman S1 is cyberpunk perfection. S2 with Mackie declines. Visual splendor. Blade Runner TV energy. Incomplete.

shows.title: Atlanta
shows.scoring_notes: Glover surreal Atlanta. Paper Boi, Earn, Darius. S1-2 peak. S3-4 experimental. TV as art. Complete.

shows.title: Twin Peaks (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: Who killed Laura Palmer? Lynch changed TV forever. S1 perfect, S2 uneven. Cooper is iconic. Surreal humor and genuine dread. The Return (S3) is superior but S1-2 started it.

shows.title: Taboo
shows.scoring_notes: Hardy intensity. 1814 London. Knight and Hardy collab. S2 coming.

shows.title: The Deuce
shows.scoring_notes: NYC porn era. Franco and Gyllenhaal. Simon Times Square.

shows.title: The Night Of
shows.scoring_notes: Ahmed breakout. Turturro icon. NYC justice system.

shows.title: Tabula Rasa
shows.scoring_notes: Belgian psychological thriller. Veerle Baetens stars as amnesiac woman suspected of missing man's disappearance. Nonlinear narrative reveals layers of trauma and mystery. Atmospheric and unsettling. Complete limited series with satisfying conclusion.

shows.title: Evil
shows.scoring_notes: King brothers' supernatural procedural. Katja Herbers, Mike Colter, Aasif Mandvi investigate possessions and miracles. Balances skepticism and faith brilliantly. Four seasons of increasing weirdness. Michael Emerson's villain is spectacular. Complete series, satisfying conclusion.

shows.title: What We Do in the Shadows
shows.scoring_notes: Vampire roommates in Staten Island mockumentary. Kayvan Novak, Matt Berry, Natasia Demetriou, Harvey Guillén perfect ensemble. Five seasons of supernatural absurdity. Complete series with satisfying finale. Consistently hilarious, surprisingly heartfelt.

shows.title: The West Wing
shows.scoring_notes: Sorkin's idealistic White House drama. S1-4 are masterpieces (Sorkin era). Walk-and-talk dialogue perfection. Peak TV political drama. Complete series with declining final seasons.

shows.title: Stranger Things (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: 80s nostalgia monster mash. S1 is perfect TV. S2 expands. S3-4 bloat. S1-2 represent peak. Eleven's origin story. Duffer Brothers' cultural phenomenon.

shows.title: Banshee
shows.scoring_notes: Amish country crime. Starr perfect as Hood. Ultra-violent pulp. Hidden gem.

shows.title: Mildred Pierce
shows.scoring_notes: Winslet masterpiece. Haynes depression era. HBO miniseries.

shows.title: 12 Monkeys
shows.scoring_notes: Movie adaptation exceeds source. Stanford and Schull. 4 seasons complete time loop. Ending is perfect. Syfy gem.

shows.title: The White Lotus
shows.scoring_notes: Resort satire. Anthology cast. Coolidge iconic. S1 Sicily, S2 Hawaii. HBO prestige.

shows.title: Show Me a Hero
shows.scoring_notes: Simon housing drama. Isaac as Wasicsko. Yonkers segregation.

shows.title: The Third Day
shows.scoring_notes: HBO folk horror. Jude Law and Naomie Harris in separate stories. Immersive theatrical 'Summer' and 'Winter' halves. Innovative live 'Autumn' episode. Visually stunning but narratively opaque.

shows.title: The Morning Show
shows.scoring_notes: Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon in cutthroat morning news drama. Started with #MeToo reckoning, evolved into broader media critique. Strong ensemble including Steve Carell, Billy Crudup. S3 loses some focus but performances remain compelling. Four seasons, ongoing.

shows.title: Only Murders in the Building
shows.scoring_notes: Steve Martin, Martin Short, Selena Gomez as true crime podcasters solving murders in their NYC apartment building. Perfect chemistry between leads. Four seasons of cozy mystery with genuine heart. Witty writing, great guest stars. Ongoing but consistently delightful.

shows.title: Mindhunter (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: Fincher's serial killer birth. FBI behavioral science unit. S1-2 exceptional. Cancelled too soon. McCallany and Groff perfect. Fincher's best TV work. Incomplete but essential.

shows.title: Sherlock (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Cumberbatch iconic. Freeman perfect Watson. S1-3 peak. Modern Holmes.

shows.title: Mindhunter
shows.scoring_notes: Fincher serial killer birth. FBI behavioral science. Cancelled too soon.

shows.title: Fringe (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: X-Files spiritual successor. Noble as Walter Bishop is TV gold. S1-3 monster-of-week to mythology. S4-5 decline. Complete.

shows.title: John Adams
shows.scoring_notes: Giamatti as Adams. HBO founding fathers. McCullough adaptation.

shows.title: Tales from the Loop
shows.scoring_notes: Amazon sci-fi anthology based on Simon Stålenhag art. Slow, contemplative, stunningly beautiful. Each episode standalone but connected by small town and mysterious underground machine. Less about plot, more about mood and human moments. Polarizing pacing but visually unmatched.

shows.title: Search Party
shows.scoring_notes: Alia Shawkat as narcissistic millennial searching for missing college acquaintance. Satirical mystery evolves into something much darker. Five seasons of tonal shifts executed brilliantly. Sharp writing on privilege and self-obsession. Complete series with audacious finale.

shows.title: House of Cards (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: Spacey's Frank Underwood breaks fourth wall. S1-2 are political thriller perfection. Later seasons decline, final season disaster. Score for peak S1-2. Wright dominates.

shows.title: Veep
shows.scoring_notes: Louis-Dreyfus as Selina Meyer. Iannucci political satire. Insults legendary. Complete 7 seasons. West Wing nightmare.

shows.title: The Crown (S1-2)
shows.scoring_notes: Foy and Smith are QEII and Philip. S1-2 are best. Cast changes weaken later. Royal drama at its finest. Expensive, beautiful, slow. Complete.

shows.title: Big Little Lies (S1)
shows.scoring_notes: Witherspoon, Kidman, Dern. Monterey secrets. S1 peak.

shows.title: We Own This City
shows.scoring_notes: Baltimore Gun Trace Task Force. Simon returns. Bernthal.

shows.title: Bordertown
shows.scoring_notes: Finnish crime series. Ville Virtanen as detective in town bordering Russia. Nordic noir with unique borderland setting. Explores human trafficking and cross-border crime. Three seasons with complete resolution. Solid procedural with atmospheric location work.

shows.title: Unforgotten
shows.scoring_notes: Nicola Walker (then Sanjeev Bhaskar) leads cold case unit. Each season excavates decades-old murder with devastating impact on suspects' present lives. Intimate character studies disguised as procedural. Five seasons of exceptional quality. Complete series with emotional farewell.

shows.title: Poker Face
shows.scoring_notes: Lyonne as Columbo. Johnson howcatchem. S1 excellent. Case-of-week procedural. Comfort mystery TV. Peacock gem.

shows.title: Arrested Development (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Bluth family dysfunction. Bateman, Cross, Arnett. S1-3 Fox peak. Netflix seasons weak. Joke density unmatched. Complete.

shows.title: Maid
shows.scoring_notes: Qualley excellent. Domestic abuse survival. Margaret Qualley breakout. Limited series.

shows.title: The Returned (Les Revenants)
shows.scoring_notes: French supernatural masterpiece. Deceased residents return to small Alpine village unchanged. Moody, atmospheric, deeply emotional. Mogwai score is haunting. Slow-burn mystery that prioritizes character over answers. Two seasons, complete story.

shows.title: Wallander
shows.scoring_notes: Kenneth Branagh as Henning Mankell's troubled Swedish detective. Bleak, atmospheric Swedish landscapes mirror Wallander's depression. Branagh's nuanced performance across four seasons. Morally complex cases. Complete series with definitive ending. Superior to other adaptations.

shows.title: River
shows.scoring_notes: Stellan Skarsgård as detective seeing dead people after partner's murder. Psychological crime with supernatural elements. Nicola Walker's presence haunts throughout. Abi Morgan's writing is character-focused and melancholic. One perfect season, complete story. Underrated gem.

shows.title: In the Flesh
shows.scoring_notes: BBC zombie drama with unique angle: Partially Deceased Syndrome sufferers reintegrate into society. Luke Newberry as Kieren Walker deals with guilt and discrimination. Two seasons exploring prejudice and redemption. CANCELED but relatively complete. Powerful allegory, memorable characters.

shows.title: The Gilded Age
shows.scoring_notes: Julian Fellowes' American Downton Abbey. 1880s New York moneyed class. Christine Baranski and Carrie Coon lead rival families. Lavish costumes and sets. HBO prestige comfort viewing.

shows.title: Ozark (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Bateman and Linney in money laundering nightmare. S1-3 are peak. S4 split and declined. Darker than Breaking Bad? Maybe. Missouri lake tension. Complete.

shows.title: Person of Interest (S1-4)
shows.scoring_notes: Nolan procedural. Caviezel and Emerson. S1-4 AI thriller peak. S5 wraps. Prescient about surveillance. Network TV at its best.

shows.title: Silicon Valley
shows.scoring_notes: Judge tech satire. Middleditch, Miller, Kumail. Startup absurdity. Complete 6 seasons. Tech accurate and funny.

shows.title: Luther
shows.scoring_notes: Elba magnetic. London noir. Alice Morgan iconic. Dark psychological crime.

shows.title: The Killing (US)
shows.scoring_notes: US adaptation of Danish series. Mireille Enos and Joel Kinnaman as Seattle detectives. Rain-soaked atmosphere, moody cinematography. Rosie Larsen case across two seasons, then new cases. CANCELED twice, revived twice. Watch Danish original (Forbrydelsen) for purist version.

shows.title: The Last Kingdom
shows.scoring_notes: Uhtred of Bebbanburg. Saxon vs Dane. Cornwell adaptation. Dreymon excellent. Complete 5 seasons. Historical action done right.

shows.title: The Tunnel
shows.scoring_notes: Anglo-French adaptation of Bron/Broen. Stephen Dillane and Clemence Poesy as detectives from UK and France. Channel Tunnel setting creates unique cross-border dynamic. Three seasons with complete resolution. Solid but overshadowed by Swedish original and US remake.

shows.title: From
shows.scoring_notes: Harold Perrineau leads trapped town mystery. Residents can't escape, night creatures hunt them. LOST-style mystery with horror elements. Three seasons of deepening mythology. Character work strong, answers coming slowly. MGM+ sleeper hit, cult following.

shows.title: ER
shows.scoring_notes: Medical drama gold standard. Clooney, Wyle, Edwards era was peak. 15 seasons of varying quality but S1-5 are exceptional. Fast-paced, emotional, influential. Complete series.

shows.title: Firefly
shows.scoring_notes: Space western cancelled too soon. Whedon's best ensemble. 14 episodes of perfection. Serenity movie completes story. Fox scheduling killed it. Cult following deserved.

shows.title: Vikings (S1-4)
shows.scoring_notes: Ragnar Lothbrok saga. S1-4 Vikings at peak. Travis Fimmel iconic. S5-6 without Ragnar decline. Historical action drama.

shows.title: Narcos: Mexico
shows.scoring_notes: Mexico spinoff. Pena and Luna. Guadalajara cartel.

shows.title: The Stranger
shows.scoring_notes: Harlan Coben adaptation. Richard Armitage's suburban life unravels by mysterious stranger. Fast-paced mystery with multiple plot threads. Some twists strain credibility but entertaining throughout. Limited series.

shows.title: Marcella
shows.scoring_notes: Anna Friel as detective with dissociative fugue investigating serial killers. Nordic noir by The Bridge creator. Friel's unhinged performance carries the show. Plot becomes increasingly convoluted across three seasons. Stylish but emotionally draining.

shows.title: Shrinking
shows.scoring_notes: Jason Segel as grieving therapist who stops holding back. Harrison Ford steals scenes as fellow therapist with Parkinson's. Warm, funny, emotionally honest. Ted Lasso creative team brings similar heart. Two seasons, ongoing. Therapy as comedy works surprisingly well.

shows.title: Abbott Elementary
shows.scoring_notes: Quinta Brunson's mockumentary about Philadelphia public school teachers. Warm, funny, socially conscious without being preachy. Sheryl Lee Ralph and Janelle James steal scenes. Four seasons, ongoing. Mockumentary format feels fresh. Network sitcom at its best.

shows.title: Little America
shows.scoring_notes: Anthology series about immigrant experiences in America. Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon's passion project. Two seasons of heartfelt, human stories. Complete series. Authentic and moving.

shows.title: Freaks and Geeks
shows.scoring_notes: Apatow and Feig's high school masterpiece. Rogen, Franco, Segel, Cardellini before fame. 1980 Michigan authenticity. Cancelled after 18 episodes. Complete cult classic.

shows.title: Industry
shows.scoring_notes: Graduate finance. London IB. HBO/BBC hybrid. Young sharks.

shows.title: The Night Agent
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix political thriller. Gabriel Basso as FBI agent pulled into conspiracy. Fast-paced, propulsive narrative. Action sequences well-executed. Pure popcorn entertainment done well.

shows.title: Homeland (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Danes and Lewis electric. S1 thriller perfection. CIA mental health drama.

shows.title: Cardinal
shows.scoring_notes: Canadian crime series. Billy Campbell as troubled detective John Cardinal in frozen Northern Ontario. Atmospheric winter setting is character itself. Four seasons based on Giles Blunt novels. Methodical pacing, strong character work. Complete series with satisfying arc.

shows.title: Billions
shows.scoring_notes: Damian Lewis vs Paul Giamatti as hedge fund king vs US Attorney. Sharp dialogue on wealth and power. Seven seasons, complete. Showtime's premium soap opera. Consistently entertaining if diminishing returns.

shows.title: Shardlake
shows.scoring_notes: CJ Sansom adaptation. Arthur Hughes as hunchback lawyer in Tudor England. Historical mystery with political intrigue. Four-episode limited series. Well-crafted but niche appeal.

shows.title: Bloodline (S1)
shows.scoring_notes: Kyle Chandler in Florida Keys family drama. S1 is masterful slow-burn. S2-3 decline. 'We're not bad people... but we did a bad thing.' Mendelsohn is Danny Rayburn.

shows.title: The New Look
shows.scoring_notes: Apple fashion drama. Dior/Chanel story.

shows.title: Requiem
shows.scoring_notes: British supernatural thriller. Lydia Wilson as cellist investigating her past. Folk horror elements in Welsh setting. Atmospheric but pacing drags. Ambiguous ending divided audiences.

shows.title: Professor T
shows.scoring_notes: Ben Miller as eccentric criminology professor assisting police. Belgian original is superior, but ITV remake finds its own charm. Miller's OCD and brilliant deductions drive the show. Three seasons. Light procedural with academic twist. Watch Belgian version for darker take.

shows.title: Alias (S1-3)
shows.scoring_notes: Garner is Sydney Bristow. S1-3 peak spy thriller. S4-5 decline. Abrams TV launch. Bradley Cooper early role. Action heroine icon.

shows.title: Bodyguard
shows.scoring_notes: Madden excellent. BBC thriller sensation. 6 episodes perfect.

shows.title: Treme
shows.scoring_notes: Post-Katrina New Orleans. Simon jazz love letter. 4 seasons.

shows.title: Mythic Quest
shows.scoring_notes: Rob McElhenney leads video game studio comedy. Always Sunny team brings similar energy but more heart. Three seasons. Industry satire with genuine character growth. Apple's most underrated comedy.

shows.title: Killjoys
shows.scoring_notes: Bounty hunters in space. Canadian Syfy. Complete 5 seasons. Fun action sci-fi. Lovretta from Lost Girl. Space Western vibes.

shows.title: The Comeback
shows.scoring_notes: Kudrow brilliance. Reality TV satire. Cancelled then revived. HBO comedy.

shows.title: Safe
shows.scoring_notes: Harlan Coben adaptation. Michael C. Hall as widowed surgeon searching for missing daughter. Gated community secrets. Formulaic but competently executed. Twist-heavy narrative keeps engagement.

shows.title: The Bay
shows.scoring_notes: Morven Christie as family liaison officer in Morecambe. Lancashire coastal setting adds atmosphere. Family secrets and community ties. Four seasons with cast changes. Solid procedural with emotional stakes. Not groundbreaking but reliably compelling.

shows.title: Shantaram
shows.scoring_notes: Adaptation of Gregory David Roberts' novel. Charlie Hunnam as escaped convict in 1980s Bombay. Epic scope, beautiful Mumbai locations. CANCELED after one season despite potential. Books fans divided on adaptation. Atmospheric but incomplete story.

shows.title: Love, Death & Robots
shows.scoring_notes: Animated anthology. Shorts excellence. Variable quality. Visual experimentation. Jibaro is art. Adult animation.

shows.title: The Righteous Gemstones
shows.scoring_notes: McBride televangelist satire. Goodman, McBride, Edi Patterson. 3 seasons. Equal parts cringe and heart. HBO comedy gem.

shows.title: Enlightened
shows.scoring_notes: Dern and White. Corporate wellness. HBO quiet gem.

shows.title: Stay Close
shows.scoring_notes: Harlan Coben adaptation. Cush Jumbo and James Nesbitt in intersecting mysteries. Northern England setting. Solid performances elevate familiar material. Less impactful than Coben's best.

shows.title: The Bridge (US)
shows.scoring_notes: US adaptation of Danish/Swedish Bron. Diane Kruger and Demian Bichir as detectives from El Paso and Juarez. US-Mexico border setting is compelling. Two seasons with complete arc. Watch original Bron/Broen for superior version, but this stands on its own.

shows.title: Annika
shows.scoring_notes: Nicola Walker as DI Annika Strandhed leading Marine Homicide Unit in Scotland. Breaking fourth wall direct to camera is divisive. Boat-based investigations unique. Walker's charm carries the show. Three seasons, ongoing. Light entertainment more than hard crime.

shows.title: Physical
shows.scoring_notes: Rose Byrne as 1980s San Diego housewife with eating disorder discovers aerobics. Dark comedy about body image and ambition. Three seasons, complete. Byrne's voiceover is sharp. Period detail excellent.

shows.title: Leverage
shows.scoring_notes: Robin Hood heist team. Hutton leads ensemble. Fun caper each week. Complete. 2021 revival exists. Original is pure comfort TV.

shows.title: Ripper Street
shows.scoring_notes: Whitechapel aftermath. Macfadyen and Flynn. Victorian crime.

shows.title: Carnivale
shows.scoring_notes: Dust Bowl fantasy. Brown and Sloan. HBO cult classic. 2 seasons.

shows.title: The 100 (S1-5)
shows.scoring_notes: Post-apocalyptic teen drama. S1-5 moral complexity. S6-7 decline. Darker than CW typical. Complete. 100 episodes.

shows.title: Travelers
shows.scoring_notes: Consciousness time travel. McCormack leads. Stargate creator complete story. 3 seasons. Thoughtful sci-fi. Netflix saved it.

shows.title: Parks and Recreation
shows.scoring_notes: S1 weak. S2-7 peak comedy. Poehler Leslie Knope. Nick Offerman Ron Swanson. Complete. Comfort sitcom gold.

shows.title: Dexter (S1-4)
shows.scoring_notes: Hall iconic as Dexter. S1-4 peak. S5-8 disaster. Trinity Killer arc.

shows.title: The Office (UK)
shows.scoring_notes: Gervais as Brent. Cringe birthplace. UK original. 2 seasons + specials. Perfect ending.

shows.title: In Treatment
shows.scoring_notes: Byrne as therapist. Session format. HBO intimacy.

shows.title: Glitch
shows.scoring_notes: Australian returned-from-dead mystery. Small town police officer deals with wife and others returning. Unique outback setting. Character-driven with supernatural elements. Three seasons with complete resolution. Solid if not groundbreaking.

shows.title: Your Honor
shows.scoring_notes: Bryan Cranston as judge covering up son's hit-and-run. S1 strong with moral descent. S2 unnecessary continuation weakens impact. Watch S1 only for complete story.

shows.title: Better Things
shows.scoring_notes: Adlon single mother portrait. Autobiographical FX gem. 5 seasons complete. Quiet, real, beautiful.

shows.title: Looking
shows.scoring_notes: SF gay life. Groff and Tovey. HBO intimate. Film finale.

shows.title: Traces
shows.scoring_notes: Molly McCarthy as forensic scientist in Dundee SIFA lab. Based on Val McDermid's characters. Technical detail on forensics is authentic. Two seasons, complete arc. Martin Compston adds presence. Solid but unexceptional procedural.

shows.title: Defending Jacob
shows.scoring_notes: Chris Evans and Michelle Dockery as parents whose son is accused of murder. Jaeden Martell excels as accused teen. Limited series based on William Landay novel. Atmospheric but pacing drags. Ambiguous ending faithful to source. Single season complete.

shows.title: Home Before Dark
shows.scoring_notes: Young girl journalist solves cold case in small town. Based on real-life journalist Hilde Lysiak. Two seasons, complete. Family-friendly mystery with genuine heart.

shows.title: White Collar
shows.scoring_notes: Bomer and DeKay buddy crime. USA Network popcorn TV. Light, fun, complete. Con man turned FBI consultant. Comfort TV.

shows.title: The Killing
shows.scoring_notes: Seattle rain noir. Enos and Kinnaman. AMC/Netflix rescue.

shows.title: City on a Hill
shows.scoring_notes: Kevin Bacon as corrupt FBI agent in 1990s Boston. Aldis Hodge as straight-laced DA partner. Three seasons of crime and corruption. Complete series. Solid but unexceptional.

shows.title: Behind Her Eyes
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix psychological thriller. Simona Brown and Eve Hewson in twisty affair/mystery. Bonkers third act twist that divides audiences. Trashy but compelling. Character psychology strains credibility but keeps you watching. Limited series.

shows.title: Truth Be Told
shows.scoring_notes: Octavia Spencer as podcaster investigating old case she may have gotten wrong. Aaron Paul as convicted murderer. S1 is strongest, later seasons decline. Three seasons total. Solid but unexceptional thriller. Apple TV+ early catalog filler.

shows.title: Burn Notice
shows.scoring_notes: Donovan as burned spy. Miami sun and explosions. USA Network action. Complete 7 seasons. Fun, formulaic, satisfying.

shows.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
shows.scoring_notes: Larry David plays himself. Cringe comedy master. Seinfeld energy. 12 seasons complete. Improv structure. HBO comedy peak.

shows.title: Misfits
shows.scoring_notes: ASBO superheroes. Sheehan and Stewart. UK comedy gold. S1-3 peak. E4 cult classic.

shows.title: Crazyhead
shows.scoring_notes: British supernatural comedy. Amy and Raquel hunt demons in Bristol. Tone mixes Buffy-style humor with darker elements. CANCELED after one season on cliffhanger. Fun chemistry between leads but limited impact. Six episodes, cult following.

shows.title: Elementary
shows.scoring_notes: Miller and Liu as Holmes/Watson. 7 seasons of procedural quality. Different from BBC Sherlock. Complete modern adaptation.

shows.title: Eureka
shows.scoring_notes: Town of geniuses. Ferguson is likable sheriff. Sci-fi comfort TV. 5 seasons complete. Fun science mysteries. Syfy classic.

shows.title: The Librarians
shows.scoring_notes: Library protecting artifacts. Wyle hosts. Fun adventure vibes. Movie spinoff. 4 seasons complete. Comfort fantasy TV.

shows.title: Continuum
shows.scoring_notes: Time cop from 2077. Nichols excellent. Corporate future vs rebels. Canadian sci-fi. 4 seasons complete. Underrated time travel.

shows.title: The Office US
shows.scoring_notes: Carell era S2-7 peak. S8-9 decline painful. Jim and Pam. Dwight Shrute. US adaptation succeeds UK. Comfort classic.

shows.title: This Country
shows.scoring_notes: Cotswolds mockumentary. Cooper siblings. Rural UK comedy. BBC Three gem.

shows.title: Young Wallander
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix prequel to Wallander. Kristoffer Nyholm plays younger Kurt. English-language despite Swedish setting feels awkward. Origin story approach diminishes mystery. Two seasons but lacks depth of Branagh version. Watch original instead.

shows.title: Tales of the Empire
shows.scoring_notes: Star Wars anthology focused on Imperial characters. Morgan Elsbeth and Barriss Offee stories. Animation quality high but limited character depth. For completists only.

shows.title: Warehouse 13
shows.scoring_notes: Artifacts with powers. Saul Rubinek leads. X-Files Warehouse vibe. Syfy comfort TV. 5 seasons complete. Fun, episodic.

shows.title: Brassic
shows.scoring_notes: Northern crime comedy. Gilgun and Keegan. Working class chaos. Sky original.

shows.title: High Maintenance
shows.scoring_notes: Weed dealer anthology. Sinclair as The Guy. NYC vignettes.

shows.title: Doctor Who (2005)
shows.scoring_notes: Tennant and Smith eras peak. BBC sci-fi icon. Family adventure. 60 years of history. Variable quality.

shows.title: Togetherness
shows.scoring_notes: Duplass brothers. LA couples. HBO cancelled early.

shows.title: Surface
shows.scoring_notes: Gugu Mbatha-Raw as woman with amnesia piecing together her past. San Francisco setting is glossy but hollow. Psychological thriller that thinks it's smarter than it is. Two seasons, ongoing. Surface-level character work despite Mbatha-Raw's efforts. Disappointing.

shows.title: Skins (UK)
shows.scoring_notes: Bristol teen drama. Generation 1 peak. Hoult, Kaya Scodelario. Raw teen chaos. E4 essential.

shows.title: Extrapolations
shows.scoring_notes: Climate change anthology with A-list cast. Meryl Streep, Kit Harington, Sienna Miller among ensemble. Well-intentioned but preachy and disjointed. Future scenarios lack urgency despite subject matter. Limited series, complete but underwhelming. Missed opportunity.

shows.title: The Changeling
shows.scoring_notes: LaKeith Stanfield as father in dark fairy tale about parenthood. Atmospheric horror with social commentary. Pacing issues but visuals striking. Ongoing.

shows.title: Revolution 9
shows.scoring_notes: BBC satire thriller. Corporate dystopia with dark humor. Limited scope but sharp writing. For fans of Black Mirror adjacent content.

shows.title: Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt
shows.scoring_notes: Kemper's wide-eyed optimist. Fey's 30 Rock DNA. Not drama but comedy excellence. Complete. Titus Andromedon is iconic.

shows.title: Dark Matter
shows.scoring_notes: Amnesia crew in space. Stargate alumni. Cancelled on cliffhanger. 3 seasons incomplete. Fun while it lasted.

shows.title: Its Always Sunny in Philadelphia (S1-8)
shows.scoring_notes: Gang is terrible people. S1-8 peak. Still running, still funny. Charlie Day breakout. Anti-comedy comfort food.

shows.title: Peep Show
shows.scoring_notes: POV sitcom. Mitchell and Webb. Mark and Jeremy. 9 seasons. Cringe masterpiece.

shows.title: Torchwood
shows.scoring_notes: Doctor Who adult spinoff. Barrowman as Captain Jack. Cardiff sci-fi. Children of Earth masterpiece.

shows.title: Let the Right One In
shows.scoring_notes: Showtime vampire series based on Swedish film. CANCELED after one season. Atmospheric but fails to capture original's magic. Watch the original film instead.

shows.title: Echo 3
shows.scoring_notes: Mark Boal (Hurt Locker) creates hostage rescue thriller. Luke Evans and Michiel Huisman as brothers-in-law saving scientist in Colombia. Action sequences are solid but characters are thin. CANCELED after one season. Watchable but forgettable military thriller.

shows.title: Lost Girl
shows.scoring_notes: Canadian succubus procedural. Bisexual lead matter-of-fact. Fae worldbuilding. Fun supernatural comfort TV. 5 seasons complete.

shows.title: Resurrection
shows.scoring_notes: US adaptation of The Returned concept. Dead Missouri residents return home. Omar Epps leads. Lacks atmosphere and depth of French original. CANCELED after 2 seasons without resolution. Watch Les Revenants instead.

shows.title: Sanctuary
shows.scoring_notes: Tapping as immortal doctor. Abnormal creatures. Heavy CGI. Syfy creature feature. 4 seasons complete. Amanda Tapping vehicle.

shows.title: The Inbetweeners
shows.scoring_notes: Suburban teen embarrassment. UK sitcom perfection. Will, Simon, Jay, Neil. Cringe comedy.

shows.title: Dear Edward
shows.scoring_notes: Jason Katims (Friday Night Lights) adapts Ann Napolitano novel. Young boy sole survivor of plane crash. Grief and connection stories among victim families. Tender but overly sentimental. CANCELED after one season. Connie Britton adds presence. Manipulative emotion.

shows.title: Tell Me You Love Me
shows.scoring_notes: Couples therapy. HBO explicit. One season.

shows.title: The Last Thing He Told Me
shows.scoring_notes: Jennifer Garner as woman searching for missing husband. Based on popular novel but adaptation lacks tension. Aisha Tyler and Angourie Rice add support. Limited series, complete. Thriller that forgets to thrill. Apple's weaker drama offerings.

shows.title: Queer Eye (2018)
shows.scoring_notes: Fab Five transformation. Emotional reality TV. Not drama but cultural impact. Brown, France, Van Ness, Berk, Porowski. Better than it has any right to be.

shows.title: Frankie Boyles New World Order
shows.scoring_notes: Scottish satire. Dark political comedy. BBC panel show. Not drama but brilliant.

shows.title: The I-Land
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix sci-fi misfire. Kate Bosworth in Lost-meets-Black Mirror premise. Poor writing, weak character development. Notable for how thoroughly it misses the mark. Mercifully short.
